result.execSummary:
The defendant Amarri D Clay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty. Peter Masana

Defendant Amarri D Clay in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CF490 and 13CF557. Sentencing recommendations argued. Defendant made a statment. Court sentenced the defendant in 13CF557 Ct. 1 to serve 5 years in prison, 2 1/2 years initial confinement and 2 1/2 years extended supervison. Ct. 3 9 mo. jail, concurrent to Ct. 1 Ct. 8. 9 mo. jail, concurrent to Cts. 1 & 3.  A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations. In 15CF490 Court sentenced the defendant 2 years in prison, concurrent to 13CF557, 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision. 595 days credit. Defendant is eligible for the challenge incarceration program and the substance abuse program.  3:30/4:12
filed by Probation Agent Michael Reisner

Defendant Amarri D Clay in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF329 and 15CF490.  In 15CF490 defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  $518.00 costs.  No jail credit.  Must report to probation on 10-28-16.  16CF329 Dismissed.
